result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith R Barthelemy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DV surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

*Restitution is set at zero.*

Obtain and maintain employment.
Community Services weekly.

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No contact with victim, Theresa B., without prior court approval.
No drugs.
No alcohol.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Continue Mental Health Treatment and take all prescribed medications.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court, (signed 7-20-2015) and (filed 7-21-2015).  
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that a commitment be issued forthwith directing the Sheriff of Milwaukee County to take the said Defendant into custody to spend 20 days straight time, with no good time credit, as condition time in the House of Correction for said Defendant's non-compliance with the aforementioned condition of probation.   mld

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Flanagan
for review. os

Defendant Keith R Barthelemy in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Continue Mental Health Treatment 
   and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Theresa B., 
   without prior court approval.  
* Obtain and maintain employment.
   Community Services weekly. 
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DV surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zer.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 P.M.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Keith R Barthelemy in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Keith R Barthelemy in custody.  Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #2, #3 and #4 are dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-6-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Theresa B., until further order of the Court.    mld

Defendant Keith R Barthelemy in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Theresa B

Defendant Keith R Barthelemy in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Keith R Barthelemy in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
